p: Usually, infections caused by the Betacoronaviruses are mild to asymptomatic [ 19, 20]. Since the first report of CoV in the 1960s, humans have been affected by CoV infection. To date, six strains of CoVs, causing mild to severe respiratory illnesses in humans, have been identified [ 21]. Of these, four CoVs (HCoV-NL63, HCoV-229E, HCoV-OC43, and HCoV-HKU1) cause mild symptoms in humans. Contrarily, two highly pathogenic CoVs caused outbreaks of severe respiratory illness due to zoonotic transmission in humans, namely the severe acute respiratory syndrome (SARS) and MERS.
